page.title: 06FARMING CONTINUED
page.content: They go to market when they are about one year old . We keep our own Charalais and Hereford bulls for breeding. In the milking parlour a computer is used to record each cows production of milk. The milk goes into a large refrigerated tank and then it is collected by a tanker and taken to the milk marketing board dairy. We have a flock of 90 ewes and two rams and 125 lambs . These are also sold at market for meat. All the meadow grass is made into silage for winter fodder. Any straw or hay we need we now buy at Chelford or Bakewell market. Because I live on a farm I am able to keep lots of pets.
